message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.CR 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with fine-tuning language models like BERT on domain-specific corpora, which is a common topic in this sub-category. Additionally, the paper focuses on NLP tasks in the legal domain, which is a specific application of language models. 

The paper also involves machine learning techniques, which makes it likely to belong to the sub-categories cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). 

Furthermore, the paper discusses the competitive advantage of having access to large legal corpora, which is relevant to the sub-category cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as it deals with the retrieval of relevant information from large datasets. 

Finally, the paper deals with legal documents and contracts, which makes it relevant to the sub-category cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) as it involves sensitive and confidential information.
